Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
New York Department of Financial Services

Description: The Department of Financial Services entered into consent orders with six life insurance companies to resolve alleged violations of New York Insurance Regulations in deferred to immediate annuity replacement transactions.  The insurers, collectively, agreed  to pay $1,152,154 in restitution and $673,000 in penalties.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: Companion agreed to pay a penalty of $950,000 along with restitution to customers of $481,000 and a contribution of $225,000 to the Vermont Legal Aid Society to resolve allegations that it sold student insurance polices with rates that were not approved and otherwise did not comply with state regulations.

Companion Life Insurance agreed to pay $5 million to participating States in settlement of allegations of multiple violations of insurance laws found by market conduct examinations in Colorado, Delaware and Vermont.
